verses.esv: 7 In him we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of our trespasses, according to the riches of his grace,
verses.kjv: 7 In whom we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of his grace;
verses.niv: 7 In him we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of sins, in accordance with the riches of God's grace

verses.esv: 14 in whom we have redemption, the forgiveness of sins.
verses.kjv: 14 In whom we have redemption through his blood, even the forgiveness of sins:
verses.niv: 14 in whom we have redemption, the forgiveness of sins.

verses.esv: 20 I have been crucified with Christ. It is no longer I who live, but Christ who lives in me. And the life I now live in the flesh I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.
verses.kjv: 20 I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself for me.
verses.niv: 20 I have been crucified with Christ and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. The life I live in the body, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.

verses.esv: 14 who gave himself for us to redeem us from all lawlessness and to purify for himself a people for his own possession who are zealous for good works.
verses.kjv: 14 Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.
verses.niv: 14 who gave himself for us to redeem us from all wickedness and to purify for himself a people that are his very own, eager to do what is good.

verses.esv:
20 and through him to reconcile to himself all things, whether on earth or in heaven, making peace by the blood of his cross.

21 And you, who once were alienated and hostile in mind, doing evil deeds, 22 he has now reconciled in his body of flesh by his death, in order to present you holy and blameless and above reproach before him,
verses.kjv: 20 And, having made peace through the blood of his cross, by him to reconcile all things unto himself; by him, I say, whether they be things in earth, or things in heaven. 21 And you, that were sometime alienated and enemies in your mind by wicked works, yet now hath he reconciled 22 In the body of his flesh through death, to present you holy and unblameable and unreproveable in his sight:
verses.niv: 20 and through him to reconcile to himself all things, whether things on earth or things in heaven, by making peace through his blood, shed on the cross. 21 Once you were alienated from God and were enemies in your minds because of your evil behavior. 22 But now he has reconciled you by Christ's physical body through death to present you holy in his sight, without blemish and free from accusation--

verses.esv:
9   He sent redemption to his people;
    he has commanded his covenant forever.
    Holy and awesome is his name!
verses.kjv: 9 He sent redemption unto his people: he hath commanded his covenant for ever: holy and reverend is his name.
verses.niv: 9 He provided redemption for his people; he ordained his covenant forever- holy and awesome is his name.

verses.esv: 18 knowing that you were ransomed from the futile ways inherited from your forefathers, not with perishable things such as silver or gold, 19 but with the precious blood of Christ, like that of a lamb without blemish or spot.
verses.kjv: 18 Forasmuch as ye know that ye were not redeemed with corruptible things, as silver and gold, from your vain conversation received by tradition from your fathers; 19 But with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot:
verses.niv: 18 For you know that it was not with perishable things such as silver or gold that you were redeemed from the empty way of life handed down to you from your forefathers, 19 but with the precious blood of Christ, a lamb without blemish or defect.

verses.esv:
7   O Israel, hope in the LORD!
    For with the LORD there is steadfast love,
    and with him is plentiful redemption.
verses.kjv: 7 Let Israel hope in the LORD: for with the LORD there is mercy, and with him is plenteous redemption.
verses.niv: 7 O Israel, put your hope in the LORD, for with the LORD is unfailing love and with him is full redemption.

verses.esv: 20 for you were bought with a price. So glorify God in your body.
verses.kjv: 20 For ye are bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your body, and in your spirit, which are God’s.
verses.niv: 20 you were bought at a price. Therefore honor God with your body.

verses.esv: 30 And because of him you are in Christ Jesus, who became to us wisdom from God, righteousness and sanctification and redemption,
verses.kjv: 30 But of him are ye in Christ Jesus, who of God is made unto us wisdom, and righteousness, and sanctification, and redemption:
verses.niv: 30 It is because of him that you are in Christ Jesus, who has become for us wisdom from God--that is, our righteousness, holiness and redemption.

verses.esv: 24 and are justified by his grace as a gift, through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus, 25 whom God put forward as a propitiation by his blood, to be received by faith. This was to show God’s righteousness, because in his divine forbearance he had passed over former sins. 26 It was to show his righteousness at the present time, so that he might be just and the justifier of the one who has faith in Jesus.
verses.kjv: 24 Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus: 25 Whom God hath set forth to be a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God; 26 To declare, I say, at this time his righteousness: that he might be just, and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus.
verses.niv: 24 and are justified freely by his grace through the redemption that came by Christ Jesus. 25 God presented him as a sacrifice of atonement, through faith in his blood. He did this to demonstrate his justice, because in his forbearance he had left the sins committed beforehand unpunished-- 26 he did it to demonstrate his justice at the present time, so as to be just and the one who justifies those who have faith in Jesus.

verses.esv: 16 By this we know love, that he laid down his life for us, and we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers.
verses.kjv: 16 Hereby perceive we the love of God, because he laid down his life for us: and we ought to lay down our lives for the brethren.
verses.niv: 16 This is how we know what love is: Jesus Christ laid down his life for us. And we ought to lay down our lives for our brothers.

verses.esv: 12 he entered once for all into the holy places, not by means of the blood of goats and calves but by means of his own blood, thus securing an eternal redemption.
verses.kjv: 12 Neither by the blood of goats and calves, but by his own blood he entered in once into the holy place, having obtained eternal redemption for us.
verses.niv: 12 He did not enter by means of the blood of goats and calves; but he entered the Most Holy Place once for all by his own blood, having obtained eternal redemption.

verses.esv:
22   I have blotted out your transgressions like a cloud
    and your sins like mist;
  return to me, for I have redeemed you.
verses.kjv: 22 I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, thy transgressions, and, as a cloud, thy sins: return unto me; for I have redeemed thee.
verses.niv: 22 I have swept away your offenses like a cloud, your sins like the morning mist. Return to me, for I have redeemed you."

verses.esv:
2   Let the redeemed of the LORD say so,
    whom he has redeemed from trouble
verses.kjv: 2 Let the redeemed of the LORD say so, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy;
verses.niv: 2 Let the redeemed of the LORD say this- those he redeemed from the hand of the foe,

verses.esv: 10 For with the heart one believes and is justified, and with the mouth one confesses and is saved.
verses.kjv: 10 For with the heart man believeth unto righteousness; and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation.
verses.niv: 10 For it is with your heart that you believe and are justified, and it is with your mouth that you confess and are saved.

verses.esv: 16 “For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
verses.kjv: 16 For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.
verses.niv: 16 "For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.

verses.esv: 13 Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law by becoming a curse for us—for it is written, “Cursed is everyone who is hanged on a tree”—
verses.kjv: 13 Christ hath redeemed us from the curse of the law, being made a curse for us: for it is written, Cursed is every one that hangeth on a tree:
verses.niv: 13 Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law by becoming a curse for us, for it is written: "Cursed is everyone who is hung on a tree."

verses.esv: 15 Therefore he is the mediator of a new covenant, so that those who are called may receive the promised eternal inheritance, since a death has occurred that redeems them from the transgressions committed under the first covenant.
verses.kjv: 15 And for this cause he is the mediator of the new testament, that by means of death, for the redemption of the transgressions that were under the first testament, they which are called might receive the promise of eternal inheritance.
verses.niv: 15 For this reason Christ is the mediator of a new covenant, that those who are called may receive the promised eternal inheritance--now that he has died as a ransom to set them free from the sins committed under the first covenant.

verses.esv: 5 to redeem those who were under the law, so that we might receive adoption as sons.
verses.kjv: 5 To redeem them that were under the law, that we might receive the adoption of sons.
verses.niv: 5 to redeem those under law, that we might receive the full rights of sons.

verses.esv: 23 You were bought with a price; do not become bondservants of men.
verses.kjv: 23 Ye are bought with a price; be not ye the servants of men.
verses.niv: 23 You were bought at a price; do not become slaves of men.

verses.esv:
9 And they sang a new song, saying,

  “Worthy are you to take the scroll
    and to open its seals,
  for you were slain, and by your blood you ransomed people for God
    from every tribe and language and people and nation,
verses.kjv: 9 And they sung a new song, saying, Thou art worthy to take the book, and to open the seals thereof: for thou wast slain, and hast redeemed us to God by thy blood out of every kindred, and tongue, and people, and nation;
verses.niv: 9 And they sang a new song: "You are worthy to take the scroll and to open its seals, because you were slain, and with your blood you purchased men for God from every tribe and language and people and nation.

verses.esv: 28 even as the Son of Man came not to be served but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
verses.kjv: 28 Even as the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.
verses.niv: 28 just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many."

verses.esv: 6 who gave himself as a ransom for all, which is the testimony given at the proper time.
verses.kjv: 6 Who gave himself a ransom for all, to be testified in due time.
verses.niv: 6 who gave himself as a ransom for all men--the testimony given in its proper time.

verses.esv: 14 who is the guarantee of our inheritance until we acquire possession of it, to the praise of his glory.
verses.kjv: 14 Which is the earnest of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession, unto the praise of his glory.
verses.niv: 14 who is a deposit guaranteeing our inheritance until the redemption of those who are God's possession--to the praise of his glory.
